body:
Add isolated Git worktree support for each Squadron agent task. This is critical for team safety and allows agents to safely operate in parallel without risk to the main branch.

## Goals
- Each new agent task gets its own Git worktree: `.worktrees/task-XXX/`
- Main branch is untouched until merge/review
- Tasks in progress cannot conflict; easy to discard failed work

## Implementation
- Introduce `create_worktree(task_id)` in `squadron/swarm/agent.py`:
  ```python
  def create_worktree(task_id):
      worktree_path = f".worktrees/task-{task_id}"
      subprocess.run(["git", "worktree", "add", worktree_path, "-b", f"squadron/task-{task_id}"])
      return worktree_path
  ```
- Modify agent runner to execute in this workspace
- Ensure cleanup/discard logic after merge/fail

## Tasks
- [ ] Implement worktree creation, usage, and cleanup
- [ ] Document restrictions and edge cases (e.g. nested tasks)
- [ ] Update tests for multi-task concurrency
- [ ] Add usage to README (with diagram)

**Impact:** Brings safety and parallelism like top agent platforms. Prevents data loss and increases trust for enterprise workflows. 

----

_Reference: Priority 3 in 2025 scaling plan_
title: Implement Git worktree isolation for agent tasks (Safety & Parallelism)

body:
Convert the existing Next.js dashboard to a cross-platform Electron desktop application for an enterprise-friendly, one-click user experience.

## Goals
- Make Squadron a self-contained app (runs via double-click, no terminal needed)
- Use electron-vite + electron-builder for fast build/dev and cross-platform packaging
- Bundle the Python backend (Control Plane API) as a subprocess (use node python-shell or pty)
- Produce .exe (Windows), .dmg (Mac), and .AppImage (Linux) installers
- Remove need for user to start server, frontend, or write manual .env files
- Lay groundwork for future features: onboarding wizard, settings, and auto-updates

## Tasks
- [ ] Boot Electron app and show Next.js UI within a window
- [ ] IPC: Start/stop the Python backend automatically when app launches/closes
- [ ] Route API calls from dashboard frontend to backend within Electron
- [ ] Add initial installer builds for all platforms
- [ ] README/dev docs for app build/run
- [ ] (Stretch) Package Python runtime (PyInstaller/embed)

**Impact:** Changes Squadron from a developer tool into a "product" anyone can run easily. Foundation for future onboarding, updates, and better reach.

----

_Reference: Priority 1 in 2025 scaling plan_
title: Convert Squadron dashboard to Electron desktop app (MVP)
